channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from multiple RSS sources, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Think Passive Real Estate Is Safe? Here Are 9 Hidden Risks That Could Cost You
item.description: You can’t eliminate all risk from investments. After all, the zombie apocalypse could strike tomorrow and probably wipe out your entire portfolio. But you can reduce risk, even among high-return […]

item.title: How Rubrik’s IPO paid off big for Greylock VC Asheem Chandna
item.description: Asheem Chandna says he was so impressed with founder Bipul Sinha's grit and tech, he led Rubrik's $40 million Series B in 2015. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: What Being Trans in Prison Is Really Like
item.description: Amid a wave of anti-trans legislation, and the violence that often follows, four people share their experiences in the criminal justice system.

item.title: Pre-Ozempic Obesity Drugs: Effective and Budget-Friendly
item.description: Before there was Ozempic, there were these cost-friendly, safe, and highly effective weight loss drugs. FDA-approved obesity medication like orlistat (Xenical), phentermine/topiramate (Qsymia), and naltrexone/bupropion extended release (Contrave) have been on the market for decades.

item.title: Gen Z Is Dominating Their Parents in Homeownership—According to New Report
item.description: When it comes to homeownership, Gen Z might be ahead of the curve. According to data from real estate firm Redfin, more Gen Zers owned their home at 24 than their parents did (millennials and […]

item.title: Photo-sharing community EyeEm will license users’ photos to train AI if they don’t delete them
item.description: EyeEm, the Berlin-based photo-sharing community that exited last year to Spanish company Freepik after going bankrupt, is now licensing its users’ photos to train AI models. Earlier this month, the company informed users via email that it was adding a new clause to its Terms & Conditions that would grant it the rights to upload […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Enduring Use of Solitary, and New Proposed Limits That Will Likely Fail (Again)
item.description: Isolation’s damaging effects are widely known. But many facilities confine people — even youth — virtually all day, sometimes in shower stalls.

item.title: Genes vs. Lifestyle: Which Matters More for Health?
item.description: Learn how genes and lifestyle interact to affect your health over the course of your life.

item.title: Economic Surge, Housing Plunge: Why Economic Growth Is Wrecking Real Estate Opportunities
item.description: Mortgage rates recently rose above 7% for the first time this year, bringing an already glacial housing market to a standstill. The news has hit investors like a horror movie jump scare after […]

item.title: Meta AI tested: Doesn’t quite justify its own existence, but free is free
item.description: Meta’s new large language model, Llama 3, powers the imaginatively named “Meta AI,” a newish chatbot that the social media and advertising company has installed in as many of its apps and interfaces as possible. How does this model stack up against other all-purpose conversational AIs? It tends to regurgitate a lot of web search […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Officials Failed to Act When COVID Hit Prisons. A New Study Shows the Deadly Cost.
item.description: People in prison died at 3.4 times the rate of the free population, with the oldest hit hardest. New data holds lessons for preventing future deaths.

item.title: Rural Living Means Planning Ahead for Your Health Care
item.description: You’ll need to plan for health care if you live in a rural area.

item.title: 3 Steps to Buying Your First (or Next) Small Multifamily Property
item.description: Small multifamily real estate investing can lead you to financial freedom faster than you think. Compared to traditional single-family rental properties, small multifamily properties often offer more cash flow, the […]

item.title: So are we banning TikTok or what? Also: Can an influencer really tank an $800M company?
item.description: Welcome to Startups Weekly — your weekly recap of everything you can’t miss from the world of startups. Sign up here to get it in your inbox every Friday. Ticktock, TikTok: It’s been a wild week for TikTok. Even as the company starts testing its Twitter competitor in certain markets and launches its luxury secondhand shop […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Parents Paying for Their Children’s Crimes
item.description: Experts warn about a wave of legal consequences for parents like the Crumbleys, while some states consider prosecutions for kids as young as 10.

item.title: What to Say to Your Partner Who Has Prostate Cancer
item.description: Unsure what to say to best support your partner as he faces prostate cancer? Get guidance on what to say and what to avoid.

item.title: BiggerNews: Can’t Qualify for Another Mortgage? Try THESE Investor Loans w/Jeff Welgan
item.description: Want to scale your real estate portfolio faster? These investment property loans can help. Most real estate investors get stuck early on in their journey. They buy some properties and […]

item.title: The IBM-HashiCorp coupling could be more complicated than it seems
item.description: At a quick glance, the IBM-HashiCorp deal seems like a good one for both sides, but upon closer inspection, perhaps not. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: I Had a Tough Job at My Brooklyn Jail: Keeping Men From Taking Their Own Lives
item.description: As a suicide prevention aide, I had to make sure my fellow detainees didn’t harm themselves. It was surprisingly easy to get such a complex job.

item.title: How Do You Get Health Care in Prison?
item.description: People in jails and prisons are entitled to health care, but it’s not always easy to access.
